intro: Bracteolanthus dipterus, commonly known as the two-winged bract plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its unique bract structures that resemble small leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are often yellow or greenish in color. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Bracteolanthus dipterus is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or savanna habitats.
